item.description:
Wed. afternoon, the day before Thanksgiving, a film for anyone avoiding the traffic or staying in town for the holiday. We can go for coffee and discussion after the film. And we'll feel so smug not to be sitting in traffic or enduring crowds at the airport.

Change of Plans (Le code a changé) by Danièle Thompson (2009, 100 min.). Danièle Thompson (Orchestra Seats and Jet Lag) returns with an ensemble comedy featuring a who’s who of French actors, including Karin Viard, Dany Boon, Emmanuelle Seigner, and Marina Hands. A group of middle aged friends gather for dinner during the annual Fête de la musique in Paris. The atmosphere is festive and friendly, with great food, wine, and conversation. Behind the humor however, anxiety is lurking, and the masks of civility slowly drop as suspicion, jealousy, and fear emerge.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be up front by the screen at the end of the film. Look for the MeetUp sign
item.name: Change of Plans--new French film at MFA
